Job Title: Specialist, Data Center Operations

Location: Durham, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

Specialist - DC Operations

The Specialist, DC Ops Service Delivery position will be able to execute activities of Data Center Operations and provide as-needed on-site support for the local computer rooms located at the our Manufacturing Division Durham site. This position reports directly into the site Manufacturing Critical Infrastructure (MCI) Lead in the Digital Manufacturing Operations – Global Vaccines Operations (DMO-GVO) organization and will receive guidance from the Global Infrastructure Operations (GIO) data center operations governance team on the execution of operational activities. They will ensure all requests and incident tasks are handled according to standard operating procedures, work instructions, and policies. Responsible for all DC related aspects of the our Company Infrastructure Management Lifecycle for hosted equipment, including planning, coordination, installation, and decommission. Responsible for improving the overall operation, ensuring that work activities are completed within SLA parameters with a high degree of quality. Coordinates onsite activities with visitors, vendors, and other technicians as required.

Responsibilities

Strong understanding of structured cabling systems, network and connectivity standards and hardware installation.Excellent problem-solving skills, trouble shooting, analytical skills, project/task management skills are required. Must be a key contributor to the success of technical solutions.Must have the ability to constantly learn while operating in a complex and dynamic operations environment.Capacity and demand planning for the data center.Technical capacity and capability analysis for data center and local computer rooms.Must show understanding of the cause and effect of infrastructure activities impacting the Operational Technology (OT) production environment.Must demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills with high personal integrity, credibility, and energy. As applicable, develop staff and maintain effective relationships with vendors.

Required Experience & Skills

5 + years of experience in data center installations, break fix, diagnostics, and structured cabling5+ years of technical support in a data center/command center environment.Understanding of enterprise critical data center facilities and their mechanical and electrical requirementsCreating status reports for mgmt. on projects/incidentsGood understanding of data center, IT and network standards and policiesAbility to adapt to changing technology environments.Experience with tools: Sunbird DCIM, ServiceNow, SharePoint, Visio, PowerPoint. Proven ability to work independently and drive results.Demonstrated experience in a cross-function team environment.ITIL, Project Mgmt., DC, Network, or Server technical certifications would be desirable.

Education

High school diploma or equivalent required.Bachelor’s degree in computer science preferred

MSJR
